metadata.title: CVE-2018-1065 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.15.7 mishandles thecase of a rule blob that contains a jump but lacks a user-defined chain,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) by leveraging the CAP_NET_RAW or CAP_NET_ADMIN capability,related to arpt_do_table in net/ipv4/netfilter/arp_tables.c, ipt_do_tablein net/ipv4/netfilter/ip_tables.c, and ip6t_do_table innet/ipv6/netfilter/ip6_tables.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1090.98
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1093-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1093.98
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1060-aws - 4.4.0-1060.69
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1014-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1026-kvm - 4.4.0-1026.31
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.98').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1093.98').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.69').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.31').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
